answers.answer: Like dark sodas? I drink sprite all the time but it's caffeine free
You have a chance to get diabetes during pregnancy, too much sugar is not good for your body. But it happens to people who do not consume a lot of sugar as well. Just be careful

If it isn't good for momma, it isn't good for baby! A 12-ounce can of soda contains about ten teaspoons of sugar which goes along with how important it is to have a steady insulin level for babies growth. 1 you don't want gestational diabetes 2 why would you want to pump that much sugar into your body and babies? That much caffeine isn't good either but also could contributes to dehydration and constipation.Four 12-ounce cans of soda a day come to about 600 calories. That translates to a pound of extra fat gain a week, putting you at risk for a more difficult delivery and increasing the chances you might develop gestational diabetes. These are "empty calories," meaning they don't provide any of the nutrition you need. Carbonation also robs your body of calcium.You owe it to your health—and that of your baby—to have as pure a diet as possible during your pregnancy. Maybe try la Croix water, it's natural flavored and has carbonation. Once you totally cut soda out of your life you'll feel really good. You stopped now, that's all that matters!
The birth weight could be low too and also I use to drink soda ' s everyday before pergnant and I stopped completely I drink maybe 1 since pergnant
My mother loves soda and she most likely drunk it when she was pregnant to and all five of her kids turned out fine lol

I drink a gallon of water a day so I say some soda in moderation is okay. You definitely need to drink water though I feel like it has definitely had something to do preventing constipation and  swilling

Read what caffeine and excess sugars can do to you and your baby I don't drink anything with caffeine in it and if I drink a decaffeinated soda I make sure it is 1 and don't drink them often it's not healthy at all

question: Im 19 weeks pregnant..I dont really drink any water at all. I just drink soda. I know its bad but its like a real bad habit. I wanted to know what effect this might have on my baby so far. I just cut sosa off completely. But what is the damage so far. Im worried.
title: drinking nothing but soda..no water
